newsitem.title: INDIA: India to import two mln tonnes of wheat in 1996/97.
newsitem.headline: India to import two mln tonnes of wheat in 1996/97.

text.p: India will import two million tonnes of wheat in fiscal 1996/97 (April-March) to augment domestic supplies and check rising prices, Food Minister Devendra Prasad Yadav said on Thursday.

"The government has decided during the current financial year it will import two million tonnes of wheat," Yadav told the Indian parliament at the end of a debate on the rising prices of essential commodities.
"The government took the decision just now, and I am making the house aware of it," Yadav added.
Traders said on Wednesday that dwindling government reserves had caused wheat prices to rise sharply in recent months compared to prices last year.

India last imported two million tonnes of wheat in 1991/92 (April/March). It exported 600,000 tonnes of the cereal in 1995/96 and 1.07 million tonnes up to September 30 this year, when the government halted exports.
